meanings.definition: The quality or state of being monochromatic.
meanings.sent1: The monochromaticities of the painting made it look very simple and elegant.
meanings.sent2: The artist used various shades of blue to avoid monochromaticities in the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The monochromaticities of the room gave it a calming and peaceful vibe.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe displayed a range of monochromaticities, from black to white.
meanings.sent5: The monochromaticities of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: The presence of only one color in a subject or image.
meanings.sent1: The monochromaticities of the flag made it easy to recognize from a distance.
meanings.sent2: The monochromaticities of the photograph added a sense of unity to the composition.
meanings.sent3: The monochromaticities of the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The monochromaticities of the forest in winter resembled a grayscale painting.
meanings.sent5: The monochromaticities of her outfit made a bold fashion statement.
